seoTitle: How To Make Vietnamese Pickled Onion
seoDesc: Pickled Onion is delicious Tet dish in Vietnam Luna New Year, this is very popular dish because of its sweet and sour taste, delicious and crispy

directions.desc: When buying onions, please peel them, but you need to soak the water to wash the rice overnight. If there is no water to wash the rice, mix the rice flour with water and then add the onions to soak. This step is to make the onion not pungent and easy to peel.
Cut the roots, peel the onion. Dissolve 20g of salt in 1.5 liters of water. Wash the onions thoroughly with salted water, then take them out into a basket and drain.

Cook salted vinegar water: Put 200ml of vinegar, 50g of sugar, 20g of salt and 100ml of water into the pot, stir well. Put the pot on the stove to boil until the salt and sugar dissolve, then turn off the heat and let it cool completely.

Put the onions in a sterilized glass jar and then pour the vinegar and sugar water in so that all the onions are submerged. If the water is not enough to cover the onions, you can add more boiled water to cool. Use a bowl or toothpick or bamboo stick to stick the onion on top to keep the onion submerged in water, to prevent it from floating on top, it will be blackened, rotten, not crispy white and affect the quality of the whole onion jar.
Leave the onion in a cool, dry place, about 3-4 days, the onion can be eaten.
The way to salt purple onions or white onions is very simple, cost-effective, and ensures food safety and hygiene for the whole family.

description: Pickled Onion is a delicious Tet dish that is very popular because of its sweet and sour taste, delicious and crispy, which helps to prevent boredom with greasy, nutrient-rich, and indigestion-causing dishes such as banh chung, meat, fish, etc. This wild, idyllic place also appears on the daily rice tray because of its irresistible appeal.
